rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Fat and ketone metabolism in diabetes mellitus.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: These studies report attempts to induce ketosis in diabetic patients in order to obtain more information about fat and ketone metabolism in different clinical types of diabetes mellitus. All patients with diabetes mellitus have impaired ability to accelerate the metabolism of carbohydrate leading to varying degrees of hyperglycemia and glycosuria. As well as this abnormality in carbohydrate metabolism, there are abnormalities in fat and ketone metabolism which are different in the various clinical types of patients with diabetes mellitus. These studies were designed to quantitate some of these differences.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Medicine.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The relationship of affect to the excretion of three hormones.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Over the centuries physicians have noted the intimacy of the relationship between "mind" and "body". One of the many quotable statements on the subject was made in 1779 by Dr. William Buchan of Edinburgh, who wrote, "The passions have great influence both in the crate and cure of diseases. How winds act upon matter will, in all probability, ever remain a secret. lt is sufficient for us to know that there is established a reciprocal influence betwixt the mental and corporeal parts and that whatsoever disorders the one, likewise affects the ether." (7) There have been many fruitless debates over the question of whether mind or matter is primary.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychiatry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The hemicelluloses of Kapok (Ceiba pentandra).
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Plant cell wa.lls consist ma.inly ot cellulose, hemicellulose and lignin. Coniferous and deciduous woods contain ail three constituants,although in varying proportions. Cellulose is a high molecular weight,linear polymer of D-glucose residues while hemicelluloses usually coesist of D-xylose and D-mannose residues with smaller amounts of D-galactose, D-glucose, L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, 4-0-methyl-D-glucuronic acid and other sugars. The main chain of hemicellulose ie much shorter than that of cellulose and is o!ten branched. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some experiments on surface and strain energy in minerals.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The primary object of the present work was to continue the experiments on beats of solution started by Moore (1955) in the Department of Geological Sciences, McGill University. In his work, Moore accumulated a fund of technical knowledge concerned with twin calorimeter construction and technique. He constructed twin calorimeters to determine the beats of solution of finely ground quartz crystal and quartz glass. He attempted to measure the surface and strain energy of these minerals but failed because he employed a quenching technique with the coarser fractions in order to reduce the length of the solution period.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Investigation of organic material extracted from a podzol.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1947 an investigation on soil genesis was initiated at Macdonald Collage with the objective of obtaining information regarding the mechanism of the formation of podzolic soils under forested conditions. A starting point in this investigation was the hypothesis that substances leaching from the litter of the forest floor would be of especial importance in this process by, (a) contributing to the organic matter content of these soils, especially in the B horizon, and (b) being involved in the translocation of iron and aluminum within the profile.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A monoenergetic electron source for mass spectrometers and its application to the electron impact study of nitric oxide.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The presence of a retarding potential in a space charge limited diode is used to obtain the effect of an essentially monoenergetic electron beam by the R. P. D. method. The performance of an ion source, using this electron gun, is treated theoretically and tested experimentally with argon. Further tests on Xe+, N2+ and SF6- ions serves to illustrate the effectiveness of this ion source. An electron impact study of nitric oxide was made using this ion source. The ionization potential of NO was found to be 9.25 ±. 02 eV., and the ionization efficiency curve for NO+ to be non-linear near the onset. This curvature is interpreted in terms of ionization to various vibrational states of the NO+ ions. Appearance potentials were obtained for the formation of N+, O+ and O- ions from a number of processes.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Transfer of training and reactions to novelty.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: When a response acquired in a given situation is tested in a similar but different situation, typically there occurs a decrement in the trained response, as indicated by increased latency and by changes in other measures of response strength. This thesis is concerned with the nature of such decrement in the strength of the "transferred" response. The "transfer" of a response from one situation to another has generally been attributed to partial identity of the training and test situations (see Hilgard, 1956). This view has received explicit formulation in the recent stochastic models of learning (Estes, 1950; Bush & Mosteller, 1951; Estes & Burke, 1953).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Phase Relations in the Fe-As-S System.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The phase relations in the Fe-As-S system at 600°0, studied in rigid silica glass tubes where a vapor phase is always present, are as follows: a liquid field extends along the S-As join from 100 to 22.8 +/- 0.2 weight per cent sulfur. An extensive pyrite-liquid-vapor field and a narrower pyrrhotite-liquid-vapor field are separated by the four-phase region pyrite-pyrrhotite-liquid-vapor in which the composition of the liquid is, in weight per cent, approximately As = 62.5, S = 37.5, and Fe = 0.11. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Inheritance of Growth Type, Flower and Seed Color of Dollard Red Clover.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: One of the major phenotypic variables in red clover has been observed to be the habit of vegetative growth in the year of seeding. Bird (1948) has identified five growth types in the variety Dollard. As a result, there was initiated a continuing series of research projects in the Department of Agronomy of Macdonald College which has attempted to relate this variation to differences in management (Steppler and Raymond 1954); differences in source of seed (Lachance 1956); level of endogenous auxin in plants (Cumming 1956) and to difference in a variety of environmental conditions (Bristow 1957). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Coalescence Phenomena at Liquid Interfaces.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The coalescence of liquid drops at a flat liquid/liquid interface was investigated. Theoretical equations describing the rate of thinning of thin fluid films were derived and their limitations discussed. The influence of temperature, drop size and diffusion on drop stability was determined.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Ignition Delay of Propane in Air Between 725-850 °C under Isothermal Condition.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The ignition delay of fuels injected into a hot air stream has been investigated with respect to the change in the following parameters: confining tube size, fuel air ratio (6 - 30 x 10-3 by weight) and oxygen concentration in a temperature range from 725 °C to 850 °C.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mechanical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: la Ville de Montreal et ses Bibliotheques Publiques.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: L'homme moderne n'est vraiment plus seul. La pensée diffusée sous toutes les formes que nous observons à l'heure actuelle, pénètre les continents avec une rapidité remarquable. La venue de l'automatisation procure des heures de loisir plus considérables. On cherche à se distraire et à s'instruire en utilisant les principaux instruments de culture qui sont à la portée de tous, pour la formation de l'intelligence et du coeur. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Library Science.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: on the Minimax Theorem and the Solution of Finite Games.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The purpose of this thesis is to present three proofs of the minimax theorem and some theorems on the solution of finite games. The treatment is more detailed than in the original references. The necessary theory of convex sets and the basic concepts of the theory of games are introduced in the first two chapters of the thesis.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of Interpersonal Persuasion.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This work presents the results of an exploratory study of interpersonal persuasion. As such, this thesis does not offer rigorous proofs for any hypotheses concerning the nature of persuasion. What it does offer is a certain amount of descriptive data on interpersonal persuasion as it occurs within a specific social relationship; a sociological orientation to persuasion which recognizes that it transpires in an interactional setting; and some tentative hypotheses consistent with this orientation. [...]
rdf:Description.ual:supervisor: Westley, William A. and Elkin, Frederick. (Supervisor)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Sociology and Anthropology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Effects of Cortical Stimulation on Learning.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1932, Hess developed a technique whereby electrodes could be permanently implanted in the brains of intact, awake animals. The electrode mountings were small, caused no apparent discomfort, and allowed the animals complete freedom of movement. Although several other investigators independently devised their own techniques (Loucks, 1933; Chaffee and Light, 1934), subsequent work has shown Hess' method to be the most reliable (Delgado, l955a). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Geology of the Weedon Pyrite and Copper Corporation Ltd. Mine.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Weedon Pyrite and Copper Corporation Mine is located one mile north of the village of Fontainebleau, Wolfe County, Weedon Township of the Eastern Townships of Quebec Province. The Mine Property comprises of 10 claims in Ranges II and III. The nearest town is Weedon, four and a half miles to the west. The city of Sherbrooke is 39 miles south and Quebec is 99 miles to the north.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Pentose Phosphate Metabolic Pathway in Human Erythrocytes.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Ten years ago, the glycolytic system as elucidated by Embden, Meyerhof and others, along with the tricarboxylic acid system as elucidated by Krebs and others, was believed to be the sole pathway of carbohydrate metabolism. Other reactions, known to be concerned with the metabolism of carbohydrates, were considered to be side reactions of the major scheme. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Anglican Evangelicals in British Politics 1780-1833.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Evangelical party within the Church of England, led by William Wilberforce and the Clapham Sect, masterminded the humanitarian campaigns to abolish the slave trade and to destroy the institution of slavery itself. They also initiated, and directed throughout, the drive to Christianize India. Their wealth, their talented representation in Parliament, and their genius for arousing and organizing popular support, were essential factors in the successful prosecution of these three crusades.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: History.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Experimental Studies in Transplantation of Small Bowel Mucosa to the Rectum.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Progress in surgical therapy is based upon the firm understanding of the anatomical, physiological and pathological processes involved in any specific disease entity. Each contribution must necessarily be only the addition of a brick, or at best a keystone, to the vast masonry work of scientific knowledge. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Mobility of Certain Sulphides in Sulphur Vapour.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Mining geology is by its very nature one of the most financially favoured and technologically advanced branches of the science, yet its theoretical basis is in many respects surprisingly incomplete. In particular, several centuries of inquiry have failed to produce a well-documented and generally acceptable theory of sulphide ore deposition. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Extraction and Identification of Organic Phosphorus Compounds of Soils.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The importance of phosphorus in plant nutrition has been recognized since the middle of the nineteenth century, when the analysis of plant ash showed the presence of phosphates and other inorganic salts, and the use of phosphorus-containing manures and fertilizers in field experiments greatly improved crop yields. Since that time, particularly during the last fifty years, phosphorus has arrested the attention of soil scientists who have contributed greatly to our knowledge of it and its soil-plant relationships. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Diabetic Glomerulosclerosis Studies Relating to its Pathogenesis.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It is well known that since the advent of insulin and later the antibiotics, the acute complications of diabetes mellitis have become a remedial rarity and that the late vascular complications have assumed far greater prominance with regards both morbidity and mortality. Of these pathological changes only those that affect the retinal and glomerular capillaries can be considered unique for the diabetic subject. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Medicine.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Income Retention and Fixed Capital Expansion: a Group of Canadian Manufacturing Corporations, 1932-1953.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The main theme of this study is income retention of Canadian manufacturing corporations. The data with which we have worked relate to forty-three well known companies and to the years 1932-1953 inclusive. Financial data of the kind we require are almost unobtainable for the 1920's and for this reason we have not been able to make a detailed study of income retention patterns before 1932.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Transistor Amplifiers for Analogue Computers.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The problems involved in the design of a transistor operational amplifier suitable for a repetitive computer are discussed. An analysis of parallel feedback applied to an active quadripole is advanced to show that the maximum computing accuracy for a given number of transistors is obtained by employing cascaded, common-emitter stages without local feedback. The factors which determine the bandwidth of a repetitive computer amplifier are discussed and the associated stability problems are solved by appropriate shaping of the loop transmission of the amplifier. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Many Masks of Karol Szymanowski: A Commentary on his Piano Triptychs
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Karol Szymanowski's music has fascinated me for a long time. The first time I encountered his name was in Artur Rubinstein's autobiography, which recounts how they first met and narrates many anecdotes about their friendship. At the time, I was living in Brazil, and was unable to find any recordings of his music. Nonetheless, Rubinstein's ardent praise of him (“a master!”, “a great Polish composer!”, “a powerful, original personality”) made me very curious, and I did not abandon my desire to keep looking for his music. Then, when I moved to Montreal in order to start my undergraduate degree at McGill University, I was finally able to find many recordings of his works at the school's library.[...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Szymanowski, Karol, 1882-1937. Fragmenty z poematów Jana Kasprowicza.
Piano music -- Analysis, appreciation.
